Long definition: Population ID
Auto-generated unique identifier for the record.
Population Name
Alphanumeric ID number for conservation unit (CU) demographic unit. An official list of CU ID's and corresponding names can be found in the SMU/CU crosswalk in NuSEDS.
Alphanumeric ID number for stock management unit (SMU) to which this population belongs.
Describes the life cycle patterns of the salmon
There are currently nine Conservation Unit (CU) groupings for Pacific salmon.
The DFO (Fisheries and Oceans Canada) area that the unit resides in, either South Coast, North Coast, Fraser and Interior, Yukon Transboundary.
The limit reference point (LRP) represents the lower bound below which the stock is considered to have suffered serious harm.
The upper stock reference (USR) is to serves as an upper stock status threshold, signaling when management actions should be taken to reduce harvest.
A management target reference point that represents a desirable level for the stock, above the USR.
Removal Reference (RR) represents the maximum allowable removal rate (fraction of the population that can be harvested).
Definition not provided.
Definition not provided.
Lower Wild Salmon Policy Benchmark
Upper Wild Salmon Policy Benchmark
The start year the times series index became available.
The end year of the time series index.
Notes on data collection methds (data sources, methods, etc.).
Notes on data analysis (infill methods, analytical methods, etc.).
The type of year definition that is used in the dataset (e.g., calendar year, brood year).
The type of age definition that is used in the dataset (e.g., freshwater age, ocean age).
